div.p: SCOTAL, or Scotale, is where any officer of a foreſt keeps an ale-houſe within the foreſt, by colour of his office, making people come to his houſe, and there ſpend their money for fear of his diſpleaſure. We find it mentioned in the charter of the foreſt, cap. 8. Nullus forreſtarius faciat Scotallas, vel garbas colligat, vel aliquam collectam faciat, ” &c. Manwood, 216.
■—The word is compounded of ſcot and ale, and by tranſpoſition of the words is otherwiſe called aleshot.
